attributes.action: More information and better accessability to the Mental Health Service
attributes.additional_details:
As someone who has been through CAMHS (child and adolescent mental health service) I now feel at a loss. Those who turn 18 are discharged from the service with no indication of where to go next. However, it’s not just teenagers at a loss, people of various ages also struggle to seek help from a mental health service due to lack of information and accessibility of a mental health service.
It is time more help and information becomes available to those who need it urgently. There also needs to be more information provided to those leaving a child and adolescent service in order for them to be prepared when discharged.
Many people die from mental health conditions each year and I strongly believe hospitals and doctors need to provide a more accessible service along with more information to help provide a better understanding of who is there to help and how they can keep themselves safe in the meantime.
Please help support this case. I strongly believe it could save a life.
